title: Ara 2013 Pathway Single Estate Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

description: This wine is flashy and there's no denying that, starting with a heady nose of toast, smoke and orange peel. The palate is viscous and grainy on notes of mint and ginger, with barely enough acidity to maintain balance. Nonetheless, it is inherently appealing.
title: Governor's Bay 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

description: The 2008 Maté's shows more lushness than typical for the vineyard, but retains its hallmark lime-like acidity. It's almost full bodied, with a creamy, lush mouthfeel and plenty of roasted-nut complexity wrapped around melony fruit. Finishes with lingering oak spice and citrus. Drink now–2016.
title: Kumeu River 2008 Maté's Vineyard Chardonnay (Kumeu)

description: The 2008 Maté's shows more lushness than typical for the vineyard, but retains its hallmark lime-like acidity. It's almost full bodied, with a creamy, lush mouthfeel and plenty of roasted-nut complexity wrapped around melony fruit. Finishes with lingering oak spice and citrus. Drink now–2016.
title: Kumeu River 2008 Maté's Vineyard Chardonnay (Kumeu)

description: An solid introduction to the world of New Zealand Sauvignon Blanc, it's off-dry in style, with melon and honey flavors given structure by lime-like acids. Pleasant, and even if it is a bit simple, it's easy to like.
title: Grove Mill 2001 Riesling (Marlborough)

description: This is VM's big single-vineyard Pinot, but it's already very approachable. Savory overtones of damp earth, outline modest pie-cherry notes that seem somewhat delicate. Enjoy this medium-bodied wine over the next few years for its silky texture.
title: Villa Maria 2013 Taylor's Pass Vineyard Pinot Noir (Marlborough)

description: Full of butter notes, along with toasted oatmeal and Brazil nuts, this rich, oily Chard is all about New World power, yet allied to an Old World sense of balance. Honey and tropical-fruit flavors play out on the palate; toast and tangerines extend through the finish.
title: Pegasus Bay 2000 Chardonnay (Waipara)

description: The bold aromas are chili peppery, just hinting at riper fruit below, but the flavors are reversed, with peach and pineapple in the lead followed by peppery notes. This medium-bodied Sauvignon Blanc ends on notes of grapefruit and jalapeno; really good for the price.
title: Barker's Marque 2008 3 Brooms Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

description: Pungently bell peppery at first, this wine also features enough stone fruit and citrus flavors to carry the herbal overtones. It's medium in body, and finishes crisp and zesty—a very likeable summer quaff.
title: Otto's Constant Dream 2009 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

description: Made in a ripe style, this Sauvignon Blanc from Oregon-based Peter Rosback features hints of honey alongside nectarine and tropical fruit flavors. It's round on the palate; a ripe, easygoing wine for immediate consumption.
title: Sineann 2008 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

description: The Ara project has yet to realize its considerable potential. This high-end bottling is a solid, middle-of-the-road Marlborough Pinot Noir, and it displays subdued aromas of dust-coated cherries, with modestly concentrated flavors of cherry and earth and a medium-length finish. Drink it over the next few years.
title: Ara 2011 Select Blocks Single Estate Pinot Noir (Marlborough)

description: A delicate, lacy style of Pinot Noir, with pretty rhubarb-like herbal shadings to the cranberry and strawberry fruit, extremely supple tannins and hints of cocoa and coffee on the abbreviated finish. Drink now.
title: The Crater Rim 2010 Pinot Noir (Canterbury)

description: This moderately pale wine doesn't show a lot of concentration or tannic structure, but it offers charming notes of cherry, clove and cinnamon. Drink now.
title: Giesen 2010 Pinot Noir (Marlborough)

description: This wine is crisp, medium bodied and surprisingly firm for an inexpensive Merlot. Drink this wine over the next year or two for its potent cassis and black cherry fruit. Some rare beef will help show the wine to best effect.
title: Oyster Bay 2011 Merlot (Hawke's Bay)

description: Escarpment's basic blended Pinot is anything but basic in 2013. There's a pleasing mixture of red and black fruit, notes of dried flowers and thyme and hints of mocha, cola and vanilla. It's medium bodied, with a firm feel on the palate and some dusty tannins on the long finish. It should drink well through 2023.
title: Escarpment 2013 Pinot Noir (Martinborough)

description: This Merlot-based rosé offers up some slightly herbal notes of thyme and bay leaf, then complements those with understated cherry—berry fruit. It's medium in weight, yet finishes with vibrant acidity. Still hanging in there, but drink up.
title: Kate Radburnd 2014 Berry Blush Rosé (Hawke's Bay)

description: Waipara isn't usually considered Sauvignon Blanc country, but this is a creditable effort, boasting ample melon and fig flavors and a shot of grassiness on the otherwise soft finish.
title: Grey's Peak 2009 Sauvignon Blanc (Waipara)

description: The best of this year's crop of Saint Clair Pinots is the Pioneer Block 4, which boasts dark and mysterious aromas of damp earth and ripe plums. It's full bodied and creamy in texture, with hints of mocha emerging on the supple finish. Drink now–2015.
title: Saint Clair 2008 Pioneer Block 4 Sawcut Pinot Noir (Marlborough)

description: Gibbston is the coolest of Central Otago's subregions, and this wine reflects that in its delicate floral and herbal notes, even a touch of rhubarb. But there's also ample cherry fruit and a wonderfully lacy, silky texture. Long and crisp on the finish. Best from 2012–2018.
title: Valli 2008 Gibbston Vineyard Pinot Noir (Central Otago)

description: Gibbston is the coolest of Central Otago's subregions, and this wine reflects that in its delicate floral and herbal notes, even a touch of rhubarb. But there's also ample cherry fruit and a wonderfully lacy, silky texture. Long and crisp on the finish. Best from 2012–2018.
title: Valli 2008 Gibbston Vineyard Pinot Noir (Central Otago)

description: This is a medium-dry Riesling with plenty of weight and richness, but also wonderfully perfumed aromatics of citrus blossom. Lime and green apple fruit carries the palate, and finishes long, with an almost tactile sense of minerality.
title: Spy Valley 2009 Riesling (Marlborough)

description: Supple but structured, this is only the third vintage for Felton Road's Cornish Point Pinot and it is really starting to hit its stride. Touches of hickory smoke and mocha accent the dark plum and savory fruit, finishing long, spicy and with a note of brown-sugar sweetness.
title: Felton Road 2008 Cornish Point Pinot Noir (Central Otago)

description: Sauvignon Blanc has never been a focus at Kumeu River, and this is an overly lean, green and underripe rendering.
title: Kumeu River 2009 Sauvignon Blanc (Kumeu)

description: Crisply acidic, with firm tannins, this is a Pinot Noir that could use 2–3 years of cellaring. By then it should have smoothed out a little, allowing the promising aromas and flavors of plum, leather and spice to blossom.
title: Paritua 2006 Pinot Noir (Central Otago)

description: One of the top offerings from Saint Clair is invariably its Omaka Reserve. The 2010 features blackberry and cola notes that are accented by a hickory smoke tone, a harmonious and supple texture and a moderately long finish. Ready to drink now, the wine should easily last another few years.
title: Saint Clair 2010 Omaka Reserve Pinot Noir (Marlborough)

description: Smoky aromas of hickory-laced dark fruit lead the way, easily sliding into boysenberry and bacon notes on the palate. The flavors are meaty and savory, not simply fruity, while the texture is lush. One of the best examples of Peg Bay Pinot Noir in memory, it finishes long, framed by supple tannins. Drink now–2020.
title: Pegasus Bay 2009 Pinot Noir (Waipara Valley)

description: Made from fruit that was sourced from Central Otago's Bendigo subregion, this is a ripe and concentrated wine that still manages to show a surprising degree of elegance on the finish. Black cherry fruit is framed by maple syrup and brown sugar timbering. The wine seems chunky and full at first, but it smooths out and turns supple by the finish. It should drink well for the next five years or more.
title: Mud House 2010 Golden Terraces Vineyard Pinot Noir (Central Otago)

description: This is an amply endowed, round wine, with no hard edges. The ripe cherry fruit is dusted with hints of dusty earth and ground cinnamon that linger on the finish. It's a lush, harmonious mouthful of Pinot pleasure. Drink now–2020.
title: Villa Maria 2009 Reserve Pinot Noir (Marlborough)

description: Saint Clair's Pioneer Block wines are always worth trying for their expressions of Marlborough's subregional characters. This one, from deep clay soils at the foot of the Dry Hills, features a bold cherry aroma and flavor, backed by ample vanilla and baking spice notes. It's big and slightly chunky in style, but it seems likely to smooth out over the next 12 months as the dusty tannins subside.
title: Saint Clair 2010 Pioneer Block 22 Barn Block Pinot Noir (Marlborough)

description: This is favorably marked by hints of stuck flint and bold, herbal flourishes on the nose, then settles down to deliver stone fruit and citrus on the palate. For the price, it's surprisingly long on the finish.
title: Massimo 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

description: Made in a crisp, dry style, this is leaner than many other New Zealand Pinot Gris, marked by its taut texture and subtle notes of almond skin, barely ripe melon and tart citrus. It makes for a refreshing sipper, or a fine foil to delicate fish dishes.
title: Astrolabe 2014 Province Pinot Gris (Marlborough)

description: Made in a crisp, dry style, this is leaner than many other New Zealand Pinot Gris, marked by its taut texture and subtle notes of almond skin, barely ripe melon and tart citrus. It makes for a refreshing sipper, or a fine foil to delicate fish dishes.
title: Astrolabe 2014 Province Pinot Gris (Marlborough)

description: This boasts typical Marlborough characters of passion fruit and herbal notes, layered with a hint of nectarine and extra pungency. It's round in the mouth without being especially concentrated, finishing short but pleasant.
title: Dashwood 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

description: Craggy Range has put their marketing energy in the U.S. behind this largely unoaked Chardonnay. It's clean and bright, with refreshing melon and pear notes, but not a ton of weight or complexity. Drink this medium-bodied dry white now through 2018.
title: Craggy Range 2013 Single Vineyard Kidnappers Vineyard Chardonnay (Hawke's Bay)

description: The deep gold color with a hint of copper suggests some skin contact. The attractive melon, lychee and spice aromas quickly dissipate with air, leaving mot much more than a slight astringency on the finish. Sourced from Nelson.
title: Crowded House 2007 Pinot Gris (New Zealand)

description: A medium-bodied, dark-fruited Pinot, the 2007 from Allan Scott features some compost-like notes to go with smoke, cola and coffee aromas and flavors. It doesn't lack for flavor but rather for elegance, coming across as a bit chunky.
title: Allan Scott 2007 Pinot Noir (Marlborough)

description: A medium-bodied, dark-fruited Pinot, the 2007 from Allan Scott features some compost-like notes to go with smoke, cola and coffee aromas and flavors. It doesn't lack for flavor but rather for elegance, coming across as a bit chunky.
title: Allan Scott 2007 Pinot Noir (Marlborough)

description: Winemaker Matt Dicey has crafted a winner, seamlessly combining aromas and flavors of toast, cherry, smoke and dried herbs into a relatively full-bodied, muscular wine. Although firm, it's approachable now, as the finish fades elegantly into dusty tannins laced with mocha and berries. Drink now–2020.
title: Mt. Difficulty 2011 Pinot Noir (Central Otago)

description: This Pinot, from the cool climes of the unsung region of North Canterbury, is downright sultry. This shows a dense nose of blue fruit, cherry, chocolate, baking spice and violets, while the palate slinks with tart cherry and earth, hugged by elegant, fine grained tannins and a long, chocolatey finish. Drink now–2022.
title: Mt. Beautiful 2015 Pinot Noir (Canterbury)

description: With a melody of earth, ripe strawberry, dried leaves, iron, and coffee tones on the nose, the palate of this wine is backed by silky tannins, plush red fruit and a long meaty finish. Drink around a campfire on the first chilly night in fall.
title: Rockburn 2015 Devil's Staircase Pinot Noir (Central Otago)

description: Syrah is quickly gaining popularity in Hawke's Bay and this is a good example why. Reminiscent of a Crozes-Hermitage, this wine's meaty, peppery aromas and blackberry-boysenberry fruit aren't overpowering, just nicely balanced and very drinkable over the near term.
title: CJ Pask 2005 Gimblett Road Syrah (Hawke's Bay)

description: Like many Marlborough Sauvignon Blancs, this one starts off leafy and pungent, then develops greater depth of white nectarine and grapefruit on the palate. It's plump, medium-bodied and slightly creamy in texture, making it an attractively versatile option.
title: Drylands 2010 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

description: This wine boasts subtle black cherries and plums, framed in a bed of toasty, mocha-tinged oak. It's rich and silky, with a discreet dusting of cocoa on the long finish.
title: Cloudy Bay 2013 Pinot Noir (Marlborough)

description: This wine boasts subtle black cherries and plums, framed in a bed of toasty, mocha-tinged oak. It's rich and silky, with a discreet dusting of cocoa on the long finish.
title: Cloudy Bay 2013 Pinot Noir (Marlborough)

description: This is a muscular wine. Intensely colored and redolent of superripe fruit, it nevertheless remains firm and structured from start to long, dusty finish. It's almost grapy in its intensity, but also hints at coffee and cocoa along the way. Drink it now if you like your Pinots big and bold, or hold it through 2020.
title: Etude 2013 Bannockburn Pinot Noir (Central Otago)

description: The 2012 vintage was a cool one in Marlborough and this wine does show hints of tomato-like herbs. But it also has ripe, supple tannins, crisp, bright fruit flavors of pomegranate and pie cherry, with a long, silky finish. While approachable now, it should drink well through at least 2022.
title: Giesen 2012 Single Vineyard Selection Waihopai Pinot Noir (Marlborough)

description: As usual, the Wairau Reserve is Saint Clair's biggest, plushest, most opulent Sauvignon Blanc bottling. Bold and unabashedly tropical in nature, it screams passion fruit aloud, then settles down into a mouthwatering, slightly chalky finish of immodest length.
title: Saint Clair 2013 Wairau Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

description: This wine reflects many of the refinements that have crept into New Zealand Sauvignon Blanc over recent years. There's just a hint of sweatiness, not out-of-control thiols, and the texture is silky, giving a rich feel without requiring high alcohol levels. Gooseberries and pink grapefruit round to the flavor profile, ending on a clean, refreshing note.
title: Mud House 2013 The Woolshed Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

description: Vavasour has done better than this in the past, and undoubtedly will do better in the future. The 2008 just lacks a bit of the jacked-up pungency that it has had in the past, instead offering relatively tame white grapefruit aromas and flavors and just a touch of grassiness. Well made, clean and refreshing.
title: Vavasour 2008 Sauvignon Blanc (Awatere Valley)

description: Seems a bit on the woody side for now, boasting aromas of dark roasted coffee backed by hints of plummy fruit. The cedary, coffee-tinged oak continues on the palate, where it imparts a slightly dry, tannic edge to this otherwise supple, rounded wine. Give it a year or two to see if the oak integrates with time.
title: Grove Mill 2007 Pinot Noir (Marlborough)

description: This relatively small estate in the Awatere Valley continues to impress. The tomato leaf character of the region comes through loud and clear without being overbearing, being balanced by passion fruit and gooseberry flavors. It's reasonably full in body, yet finishes spicy, prickly and refreshing.
title: Eradus 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Awatere Valley)

description: A French-owned outpost in the South Pacific, Clos Henri seems to be finally coming of age. This entry-level offering delivers a hint of smoky, fumé character, but also plenty of ripe fruit, ranging from fig, melon and stone fruit to zestier notes of passion fruit. It's reasonably full-bodied, with an attractive, silky mouthfeel and a touch of gingery spice on the finish.
title: Clos Henri 2013 Petit Clos Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

description: A French-owned outpost in the South Pacific, Clos Henri seems to be finally coming of age. This entry-level offering delivers a hint of smoky, fumé character, but also plenty of ripe fruit, ranging from fig, melon and stone fruit to zestier notes of passion fruit. It's reasonably full-bodied, with an attractive, silky mouthfeel and a touch of gingery spice on the finish.
title: Clos Henri 2013 Petit Clos Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

description: Leafy at first, but those greenish notes are backed by plenty of stone fruits and pineapple. It's plump and round in the mouth, with a long, clean, zesty finish. Drink now.
title: Brancott 2008 Festival Block Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

description: Solidly mainstream in style, Whitehaven's 2009 Sauvignon Blanc displays slightly sweaty aromas to accent its red bell pepper and passion fruit flavors. It's nicely concentrated, with enough palate weight to pair with slightly rich fish or poultry dishes. Drink up.
title: Whitehaven 2009 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

description: A complex, savory Pinot Noir for $12? Yup. Hints of bacon and mushroom are prominent, with just enough cherry fruit to support them. It's light in body, with supple tannins, so drink it over the next six months or so.
title: Lobster Reef 2008 Pinot Noir (Marlborough)

description: This is an easy-drinking quaffer, the kind most people think of when they hear Riesling. It's off dry but well balanced, with slightly broad melon and peach notes. A nice patio sipper for summer 2011.
title: Skyleaf 2009 Riesling (Waipara Valley)

description: Konrad's 2008 Pinot Noir shows quite a bit of toast and vanilla to go alongside its cherry fruit. Gently toasted marshmallows impart a sweet succulence to the wine, making it attractive despite some woody tannins on the finish. Drink now–2014.
title: Konrad 2008 Pinot Noir (Marlborough)

description: Built a little more sturdily than some NZ Pinots, Rockburn's 2007 shows fine intensity and purity of black cherry flavors, allied to hints of mushroom, earth and cola. It's full-bodied, with a long, supple finish. Drink now–2015.
title: Rockburn 2007 Pinot Noir (Central Otago)

description: Dusty spice notes of ginger and cinnamon accent ripe pear and muskmelon fruit on the nose. This is rich and off-dry in style, with a round, mouthfilling presence on the palate balanced by bright acidity and a lingering note of white pepper.
title: Amisfield 2015 Pinot Gris (Central Otago)

description: Pretty straightforward Marlborough Sauvignon Blanc, but done well, featuring passion fruit, pink grapefruit and melon aromas and flavors that end on a gently herbal note.
title: Framingham 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

description: Pretty straightforward Marlborough Sauvignon Blanc, but done well, featuring passion fruit, pink grapefruit and melon aromas and flavors that end on a gently herbal note.
title: Framingham 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

description: This is a big, rich style of Pinot, with toast, vanilla and bacon marking the nose. While the palate delivers more black cherry fruit, it still remains savory overall. It's slightly chewy on the finish, so drink 2017–2025.
title: Seresin 2012 Rachel Pinot Noir (Marlborough)

description: This is a big, rich style of Pinot, with toast, vanilla and bacon marking the nose. While the palate delivers more black cherry fruit, it still remains savory overall. It's slightly chewy on the finish, so drink 2017–2025.
title: Seresin 2012 Rachel Pinot Noir (Marlborough)

description: This is ripe and muscular without being overly oaky. Cherry fruit is supported by a balanced dose of cedary oak, but the tannins come largely from the fruit, suggesting decent aging potential. The finish is dry, firm and long, further bolstering that impression. Drink 2017–2025.
title: Rockburn 2013 Pinot Noir (Central Otago)

description: This wine is broad on the palate and creamy in texture. Bruised apple aromas mar the otherwise delicate melon and peach notes, while it finishes quickly.
title: Jules Taylor 2015 Grüner Veltliner (Marlborough)

description: This seems a bit riper and rounder than most Marlborough Sauvignon Blancs, but it remains varietally on target. Gooseberry and pink grapefruit aromas and flavors finish on a mouthwatering note. Drink now.
title: Makara 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

description: This seems a bit riper and rounder than most Marlborough Sauvignon Blancs, but it remains varietally on target. Gooseberry and pink grapefruit aromas and flavors finish on a mouthwatering note. Drink now.
title: Makara 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

description: A ripe, powerful Pinot, this wine is bursting with sweet cherry, chocolate and vanillan oak spice. The palate brings forth more ripe fruit with chewy but well structured tannins and a savory finish. Drink now–2024.
title: Amisfield 2012 RKV Reserve Pinot Noir (Central Otago)

description: A ripe, powerful Pinot, this wine is bursting with sweet cherry, chocolate and vanillan oak spice. The palate brings forth more ripe fruit with chewy but well structured tannins and a savory finish. Drink now–2024.
title: Amisfield 2012 RKV Reserve Pinot Noir (Central Otago)

description: The nose on this Pinot is the kind that makes it impulsive to keep on smelling. Exotic Middle Eastern spices mix with tamarind, earth, meat and oak spice. There's power to the tannins but they're fine-grained and balanced by plenty of acidity and a savory, oak spiced finish.
title: The Better Half 2015 Pinot Noir (Marlborough)

description: This is an opulent, showy style of a sparkling wine. Notes of honey, brioche, dates and ginger lead to a rich, round texture and vigorous mousse. The finish is a little mealy and sweet but there are plenty who will dig this rich style, particularly once they see the affordable price tag.
title: Sophora NV Cuvée Sparkling (New Zealand)

description: This is an opulent, showy style of a sparkling wine. Notes of honey, brioche, dates and ginger lead to a rich, round texture and vigorous mousse. The finish is a little mealy and sweet but there are plenty who will dig this rich style, particularly once they see the affordable price tag.
title: Sophora NV Cuvée Sparkling (New Zealand)

description: Although it starts on the oaky side, the ripe red fruit, olive and baking spice notes soon come into play. The palate integrates silky tannins with plush fruit, making this a straightforward example of Marlborough Pinot Noir.
title: Catalina Sounds 2015 Pinot Noir (Marlborough)

description: The bouquet is generous, offering loads of pineapple, peach, canned peas, blossoms and grapefruit. The palate is fresh and zippy with a grassy and citrus combo will please lovers of this style.
title: Huntaway Reserve 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

description: A little shy at first, and smelling slightly synthetic, this wine needs a little time in glass. Eventually it opens to reveal notes of cherry cola and coffee spice. With chewy, dusty tannins and fairly pronounced oak, this wine is on the bigger side for a Pinot.
title: Murdoch James 2015 High Block Pinot Noir (Martinborough)

description: A little shy at first, and smelling slightly synthetic, this wine needs a little time in glass. Eventually it opens to reveal notes of cherry cola and coffee spice. With chewy, dusty tannins and fairly pronounced oak, this wine is on the bigger side for a Pinot.
title: Murdoch James 2015 High Block Pinot Noir (Martinborough)

description: Green notes lead the parade here: Grass, peas and tomato leaf march ahead of the lemon citrus notes, with an intriguing struck-match character taking up the rear. On the palate, the acidity is prominent but in check, and the slightly chalky texture is appealing. When it comes to flavor, however, it loses much of what the nose offers, finishing a little flat and bitter.
title: Mud House 2014 The Woolshed Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

description: Green notes lead the parade here: Grass, peas and tomato leaf march ahead of the lemon citrus notes, with an intriguing struck-match character taking up the rear. On the palate, the acidity is prominent but in check, and the slightly chalky texture is appealing. When it comes to flavor, however, it loses much of what the nose offers, finishing a little flat and bitter.
title: Mud House 2014 The Woolshed Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

description: Craggy's style of Sauvignon Blanc has always favored texture over flamboyant aromatics, but the 2014 offers subtle notes of tomato stalk layered over citrus fruit. Grapefruit predominates, but there's a hint of stone fruit and the hallmark Craggy creaminess to the wine's texture.
title: Craggy Range 2014 Te Muna Road Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Martinborough)

description: Craggy's style of Sauvignon Blanc has always favored texture over flamboyant aromatics, but the 2014 offers subtle notes of tomato stalk layered over citrus fruit. Grapefruit predominates, but there's a hint of stone fruit and the hallmark Craggy creaminess to the wine's texture.
title: Craggy Range 2014 Te Muna Road Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Martinborough)

description: This is a full-bodied, soft and round style of Pinot Gris that's almost completely dry. Understated pear and melon aromas combine with hints of fern fronds to create an enchanting bouquet, while the flavors are more straightforward and fruity. Drink now.
title: Jules Taylor 2011 Pinot Gris (Marlborough)

description: Loaded with fruit—apricot, pineapple and passion fruit—this is an attractive, medium-bodied Pinot Gris with just a hint of sweetness. Enjoy it over the next year.
title: Mt. Difficulty 2011 Roaring Meg Pinot Gris (Central Otago)

description: Loaded with fruit—apricot, pineapple and passion fruit—this is an attractive, medium-bodied Pinot Gris with just a hint of sweetness. Enjoy it over the next year.
title: Mt. Difficulty 2011 Roaring Meg Pinot Gris (Central Otago)

description: This dark-fruited Pinot Noir is sturdily constructed yet never seems hard or tough, thanks to the silkiness of its plentiful tannins. Black cherry fruit picks up shadings of mocha on the dusty finish. Drink 2015–2020.
title: Wild Earth 2010 Pinot Noir (Central Otago)

description: Subtly perfumed with black cherries and cola, this is nevertheless somewhat chunky and muscular on the palate. Dusty, substantial tannins frame flavors of mocha, black cherries and baking spices. Best 2015–2020.
title: Carrick 2010 Bannockburn Pinot Noir (Central Otago)

description: Despite originating from Hawkes Bay on New Zealand's North Island, this could pass for Marlborough. It's not overly big or ripe, but well-rounded without losing any sense of varietal character. Hints of tomato leaf and white grapefruit linger elegantly on the finish.
title: Mills Reef 2013 Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Hawke's Bay)

description: Better known for its aromatic whites, Spy Valley has fashioned a solid, middle-of-the-road Sauvignon Blanc. Passion fruit and pineapple flavors form the medium-weight core of the wine, while grassy notes on the nose reemerge on the finish.
title: Spy Valley 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

description: While grassy, herbal aromas dominate the aromas, plenty of white grapefruit comes through on the palate to provide for a crisp, refreshing mouthful. It's medium in weight, with some leafy and citrusy notes on the moderate-length finish.
title: Oyster Bay 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

description: Tight and linear on the palate, this is evolving very well for a $12 wine. Struck flint is prominent on the nose, adding a touch of Old World character, while the flavors feature cut grass and citrus. It's light bodied, but remarkably intense on the finish. Drink now.
title: Stoneburn 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

description: Tight and linear on the palate, this is evolving very well for a $12 wine. Struck flint is prominent on the nose, adding a touch of Old World character, while the flavors feature cut grass and citrus. It's light bodied, but remarkably intense on the finish. Drink now.
title: Stoneburn 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

description: A solid two years after the vintage, this shows the concentration of 2015. Fig, melon and nectarine notes mingle easily on the nose and palate, where a touch of creaminess adds an extra dimension.
title: Giesen 2015 Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

description: Even from a difficult Marlborough vintage for Pinot Noir, this bottling offers plenty of flavor intensity—there's lots of crisp cherry fruit—underlain with some earthy complexity. Acids are firm and will likely always remain so; it's probably best to drink this one young before the fruit fades.
title: Brancott 2006 Terraces Pinot Noir (Marlborough)

description: A nice Pinot at a nice price, kicking off with lifted cherry fruit and a tinge of minty greenness. It's medium in body, with delicate and supple tannins framing clean, fresh cherry flavors. Finishes soft, easy and with decent length and intensity, making it a pleasant quaff for spring and into summer.
title: Hunter's 2007 Pinot Noir (Marlborough)

description: Americans Claudia and Mike Weersing's estate vines are grown so close to the ground, they look almost like a bonsai vineyard. Made as naturally as possible, it's yielded a smoky, savory style of Pinot Noir that shows some dark plum and black olive fruit and a lingering, slightly chocolaty finish. The silky tannins suggest immediate drinkability, although its inherent balance and concentration suggest it'll make it to at least 2020.
title: Pyramid Valley 2010 Earth Smoke Pinot Noir (Canterbury)

description: Even at a considerable 15 g/l of residual sugar, this wine comes across as almost dry, thanks to its crisp acidity. Scents of petrichor, green apple and lime start things off, while those razor-sharp acids show up on the finish. Drink now.
title: Nelson Bay 2009 Riesling (Nelson)

description: A light- to medium-bodied Sauvignon, the 2009 Discovery is more delicate than many of its counterparts, with hints of stuck flint, accenting stone fruit and citrus flavors. Turns chalky and crisp on the finish. Drink now.
title: Discovery 2009 Sauvignon Blanc (East Coast)

description: A simple, medium-bodied Chardonnay that emphasizes the variety's fruity characteristics. Apple, pineapple and citrus pick up a hint of peppery or clove-like spice on the finish.
title: Stratum 2010 Chardonnay (Marlborough)

description: This wine seems soft and silky on the surface, but boasts a sinewy structure that should enable it to age well through 2025. Floral and cedar notes add nuance to the black cherries on the nose, while the flavors include hints of cola and herbal tea that linger on the finish.
title: Rockburn 2014 Pinot Noir (Central Otago)

description: Full bodied, rich and carrying a bit of residual sugar, this is a fine example of the variety's potential in Marlborough. Smoky, grilled-pear notes add hints of honey and melon on the palate, where despite its richness, the wine soars into a long, velvety finish. Drink now–2020, at least.
title: Greywacke 2014 Pinot Gris (Marlborough)

description: This medium-bodied Syrah is silky in texture, those soft tannins framing plummy fruit notes and hints of cracked pepper and licorice. The oak is integrated almost perfectly into the wine, leaving an impression of almost pristine fruit. Drink now–2020.
title: Crossroads 2010 Winemaker's Collection Syrah (Hawke's Bay)

description: This is a soft, ripely fruited Sauvignon Blanc, embued with hints of passion fruit and lime. It's plump and medium bodied, round on the palate, then tart and lingering on the finish. Drink now.
title: Smythe & Renfield 2011 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

description: A silky, easy-drinking Pinot Noir, but one that retains Martinborough's savory profile, featuring hints of dark earth and mushrooms alongside black cherries. Drink now.
title: Margrain 2008 River's Edge Pinot Noir (Martinborough)

description: The 2011 Mate's Vineyard appears to have more focus and drive than the Hunting Hill, but fewer curves. Toasted nuts garnish pineapple and tangerine fruit, while the finish is long, tight and richly textured. This should be long-lived by New Zealand Chardonnay standards; drink now–2022.
title: Kumeu River 2011 Maté's Vineyard Chardonnay (Kumeu)

description: A hint of stuck flint adds a touch of complexity, but this is basically a simple, fruity Sauvignon, imbued with ample passion fruit flavor. A hint of green herbs comes in on the finish.
title: 3 Stones 2009 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

description: This wine features a unique combination of stone fruit, citrus and chili pepper, making it a treat to pair with piquant dishes like ceviche. It's medium-bodied, but with plenty of freshness and zest on the finish.
title: Waimea 2009 Spinyback Sauvignon Blanc (Nelson)

description: Made in a round, soft style, this is an atypically mouthfilling Sauvignon filled with notes of nectarines, honey and ripe citrus. It's a summer crowd-pleaser for the beach crowd.
title: Harbor Town 2009 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

description: Gunn Estate's 2009 is on the green side of things, offering hints of asparagus on the nose before balancing those out nicely with white grapefruit flavors. Despite the herbal overtones, it actually seems richly weighty on the palate before turning citrusy on the finish.
title: Gunn Estate 2009 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

description: An oversupply of Marlborough Sauvignon Blanc has led to bargains like this wine, which delivers nectarine and white grapefruit flavors in a medium-bodied format. It's plump on the palate, then turns zippy and citrusy on the finish.
title: Dashwood 2009 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

description: Winemaker Helen Masters is trying to get a bit more texture into her Sauvignon Blanc by incorporating a small portion that's been fermented on the skins. It adds a bit of richness to the already ripe flavors of fig, nectarine, melon and pineapple. Drink now.
title: Ata Rangi 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Martinborough)

description: This user-friendly Pinot Noir hits the right notes, starting with its bright, crisply delineated bing cherry aromas and progressing through dark undertones of cola and fresh compost. It's round, mouthfilling and very soft, with no hard edges. Drink over the next year or two.
title: Saint Clair 2007 Pinot Noir (Marlborough)

description: With more than a quarter of million cases of this wine coming to the U.S., Nobilo's Regional Collection SB will turn up on a lot of tables over the summer—and justifiably so. It's a very good rendition of Marlborough Sauvignon, offering grassy aromas and flavors backed by lime and grapefruit. It's plump enough to have mass appeal, with a refreshingly crisp finish. Like almost all NZ Savvies, it should be consumed over the next 6–9 months.
title: Nobilo 2008 Regional Collection Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

description: With more than a quarter of million cases of this wine coming to the U.S., Nobilo's Regional Collection SB will turn up on a lot of tables over the summer—and justifiably so. It's a very good rendition of Marlborough Sauvignon, offering grassy aromas and flavors backed by lime and grapefruit. It's plump enough to have mass appeal, with a refreshingly crisp finish. Like almost all NZ Savvies, it should be consumed over the next 6–9 months.
title: Nobilo 2008 Regional Collection Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

description: This is a top value, offering unusually rich palate weight and texture in a wine this inexpensive. Ripe stone-fruit flavors finish long, picking up hints of fresh herbs and leesy richness. Drink through the end of 2017.
title: Ant Moore 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

description: This is a top value, offering unusually rich palate weight and texture in a wine this inexpensive. Ripe stone-fruit flavors finish long, picking up hints of fresh herbs and leesy richness. Drink through the end of 2017.
title: Ant Moore 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

description: It's taken some time for many of Marlborough's 2012 Pinot Noirs (the product of a cool season) to come around, but this is one that's worth the wait. It's evolved into something quite round and soft, with a long, silky finish. Yet it's not a fruit-forward wine by any stretch, showing more earth, soy and mushroom notes and just enough plum and black cherry fruit to carry those savory complexities. Drink now–2020.
title: Giesen 2012 Brookby Rd Single Vineyard Selection Pinot Noir (Marlborough)

description: It's taken some time for many of Marlborough's 2012 Pinot Noirs (the product of a cool season) to come around, but this is one that's worth the wait. It's evolved into something quite round and soft, with a long, silky finish. Yet it's not a fruit-forward wine by any stretch, showing more earth, soy and mushroom notes and just enough plum and black cherry fruit to carry those savory complexities. Drink now–2020.
title: Giesen 2012 Brookby Rd Single Vineyard Selection Pinot Noir (Marlborough)

description: Rich, toasty and custardy, this is a big Chardonnay that retains a sense of balance, with a creamy texture and a powerful core of citrusy fruit that comes through on the finish. Based on a couple of older vintages, this wine should last at least 7–8 years from the vintage, but I find them most attractive in their youth.
title: Felton Road 2008 Block 2 Chardonnay (Central Otago)

description: Lavishly oaked, but richly fruited as well, with layers of ripe peaches and grilled nuts leaving a creamy impression of luxury on the palate. The finish is long and vanilla-tinged yet features mouthwatering citrus. Drink now–2012.
title: Saint Clair 2008 Omaka Reserve Chardonnay (Marlborough)

description: From a relatively young vineyard (planted in 2000), this is a nicely complex effort, showing hints of rose pollen, cherries and herbal tea. It's round in the mouth, yet virtually weightless, showing off a wonderfully silky texture that persists through the finish. Without any real track record, opt for drinking this one on the young side (now–2012).
title: Felton Road 2007 Cornish Point Pinot Noir (Central Otago)

description: Kumeu River is one of New Zealand's most consistent producers of Chardonnay. This bottling boasts slightly austere aromas of wet stone, struck flint and woodsmoke, then delivers white peach and pineapple flavors on the palate. It's medium in body, with a slightly creamy texture and a moderately long finish.
title: Kumeu River 2012 Estate Chardonnay (Kumeu)

description: This top-flight effort features herbal, slightly pungent notes that accentuate the wine's ripe, nectarine-like stone-fruit elements. There's ample weight and richness on the palate, lightened on the finish by a fresh, green-leafy component.
title: Kim Crawford 2013 Spitfire Small Parcels Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

description: From one of the Nelson region's pioneering winemakers, this is as good a wine as I can remember the Seifried family producing. The combination of subtle snow-pea and bold passion-fruit flavors is spot on, and the wine's ample weight, slightly creamy texture and long, grapefruity finish work together to create a harmonious whole.
title: Seifried 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Nelson)

description: This medium-bodied wine smells a bit like a bouquet of pineapple, sage and lemony thyme. On the palate, the wine is restrained and citrusy, with a clean, refreshing finish.
title: Frenzy 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (South Island)

description: This medium-bodied wine smells a bit like a bouquet of pineapple, sage and lemony thyme. On the palate, the wine is restrained and citrusy, with a clean, refreshing finish.
title: Frenzy 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (South Island)

description: On the light-bodied side of the Pinot Noir spectrum, with modest red-fruit aromas and flavors accented by some funky, oaky notes of tree bark and charred nuts.
title: Opawa 2009 Pinot Noir (Marlborough)

description: This is a light- to medium-bodied Sauvignon Blanc that's clean and fresh, but not particularly intense or characterful—the kind you can comfortably serve to a non-wine crowd and expect accolades for your choice. Drink now.
title: Redcliffe 2007 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

description: This is a light- to medium-bodied Sauvignon Blanc that's clean and fresh, but not particularly intense or characterful—the kind you can comfortably serve to a non-wine crowd and expect accolades for your choice. Drink now.
title: Redcliffe 2007 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

description: One of few Kiwi Pinots typically worth cellaring, Neudorf's 2008 Moutere bottling comes across as a bit oaky, with menthol and cedar notes forming a tight overlay to the cherry fruit. Tannins are silky yet firm, suggesting the wine will be at its best 2012–2018.
title: Neudorf 2008 Moutere Pinot Noir (Nelson)

description: A New World analog to an Alsace vendange tardive, this sweet, lushly fruited Riesling displays ample honey, melon and apple fruit, with just a hint of lime zest to provide some balance to its 60 g/L of residual sugar. Try it with spicy Asian dishes, on its own or with a cheese course.
title: Mountford 2009 Riche Riesling (Waipara)

description: A New World analog to an Alsace vendange tardive, this sweet, lushly fruited Riesling displays ample honey, melon and apple fruit, with just a hint of lime zest to provide some balance to its 60 g/L of residual sugar. Try it with spicy Asian dishes, on its own or with a cheese course.
title: Mountford 2009 Riche Riesling (Waipara)

description: Starts off with a slightly funky, struck-match aroma, but then opens to reveal tangerine, nectarine and roasted-nut scents. The flavors are an blend of all that, delivered via a rich silky-textured palate and ending long.
title: Cloudy Bay 2011 Te Koko Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

description: This looks to be among the best vintages for this wine, or at least it's one of the most flattering to taste young. Stunning floral notes emerge from the glass, wrapped in ripe black-cherry scents. On the palate, it's slightly plummier, but still retains those exciting rose-petal nuances and folds in hints of spice and earth. Despite the evident suppleness, there's a sense of weight and structure that suggests ageability as well. Drink 2015–2022.
title: Ata Rangi 2012 Pinot Noir (Martinborough)

description: This looks to be among the best vintages for this wine, or at least it's one of the most flattering to taste young. Stunning floral notes emerge from the glass, wrapped in ripe black-cherry scents. On the palate, it's slightly plummier, but still retains those exciting rose-petal nuances and folds in hints of spice and earth. Despite the evident suppleness, there's a sense of weight and structure that suggests ageability as well. Drink 2015–2022.
title: Ata Rangi 2012 Pinot Noir (Martinborough)

description: Perennially one of New Zealand's top Syrahs, this full-bodied, creamy-textured wine finishes long and velvety. The black olives, espresso and cracked peppercorns on the nose are marvelously varietally true, while the palate features those dark fruit notes and a moderate dose of dried spices. Drink now–2025.
title: Trinity Hill 2010 Homage Syrah (Hawke's Bay)

description: It's taken New Zealand's largest producer a while to get on board the barrel-fermented express, and this wine is still only 50% done in wood, mainly large formats. Some funky, slightly acrid notes mark the nose, but this adds welcome complexity to the stone-fruit aromas. It's rich and textural in the mouth, the ripe fruit marked by intriguing hints of green herbs and spice before drawing to a long, elegant finish.
title: Brancott 2010 Chosen Rows Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

description: Imported by Kobrand.
title: Craggy Range 2007 Kidnappers Vineyard Chardonnay (Hawke's Bay)

description: Imported by Kobrand.
title: Craggy Range 2007 Kidnappers Vineyard Chardonnay (Hawke's Bay)

description: It seems this Italian venture is starting to hit its stride, turning in a plump, round offering layered with complexity. It starts off sweaty and pungent, then develops more melon and nectarine scents with aeration. Those flavors follow through on the palate, followed by persistent notes of white grapefruit on the finish.
title: Mount Nelson 2008 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

description: This slightly disjointed wine brings a lot of good things to the table which should integrate with time. For now, there's mushroomy complexity, candied cherry fruit, tart acids and a long, warm finish. Drink 2016–2020.
title: Greystone 2013 Pinot Noir (Waipara Valley)

description: This is a light, crisp wine for current drinking. Herbal notes make the cherry fruit resemble cherry tomatoes, while the acids carry through the tart finish.
title: Hunter's 2013 Jane Hunter Pinot Noir (Marlborough)

description: This is a light, crisp wine for current drinking. Herbal notes make the cherry fruit resemble cherry tomatoes, while the acids carry through the tart finish.
title: Hunter's 2013 Jane Hunter Pinot Noir (Marlborough)

description: Very fresh and vibrant, filled with zesty pear, citrus and pineapple fruit. Just a pleasure to drink, balancing lush fruit with zippy acids. Hints of apples and butter linger in the background.
title: Sherwood Estate 2000 Reserve Chardonnay (Canterbury)

description: Complex from start to finish, beginning with aromas of smoke, kumquats and grilled pears and ending cleanly, with tart pineapple notes. The texture is a compelling mix of gravel and custard, yet the wine never seems heavy.
title: Stonecroft 2000 Chardonnay (Hawke's Bay)

description: This relatively understated wine is less ebullient than the 2000s it was tasted alongside, but held its own, with green apple and lemon fruit underscored by smoky, earthy flavors. The lemony finish lingers a long time.
title: Mountford 1999 Chardonnay (Waipara)

description: The husband-and-wife team of Mike and Claire Allen have turned out 2,000 cases of this terrific value, which delivers authentic Pinot Noir complexity at an attractive price. Bold black cherry fruit carries subtle herb, twig and vanilla shadings with aplomb, while the texture turns velvety on the lengthy finish. Drink now–2017.
title: Huia 2009 Pinot Noir (Marlborough)

description: The husband-and-wife team of Mike and Claire Allen have turned out 2,000 cases of this terrific value, which delivers authentic Pinot Noir complexity at an attractive price. Bold black cherry fruit carries subtle herb, twig and vanilla shadings with aplomb, while the texture turns velvety on the lengthy finish. Drink now–2017.
title: Huia 2009 Pinot Noir (Marlborough)

description: This is a medium- to full-bodied wine, a bit chunky and edgy at first, but these characters should mellow with another few months in the bottle. It's boldly flavored, with black cherry and beet notes upfront, while subtle mocha and vanilla shadings emerge on the finish.
title: Spy Valley 2013 Pinot Noir (Marlborough)

description: This is a medium- to full-bodied wine, a bit chunky and edgy at first, but these characters should mellow with another few months in the bottle. It's boldly flavored, with black cherry and beet notes upfront, while subtle mocha and vanilla shadings emerge on the finish.
title: Spy Valley 2013 Pinot Noir (Marlborough)

description: Grassy, herbal notes accent pink grapefruit on the nose. There's ample weight without it ever seeming heavy, and a silky feel to the wine that lingers on the finish.
title: The Crossings 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Awatere Valley)

description: Muskmelon and lime flavors start off tasting sweet, but are quickly reined in by brisk acidity, finishing chalky and tart. This is a fine Riesling, yet slightly disappointing in the context of previous vintages.
title: Martinborough Vineyard 2001 Riesling (Martinborough)

description: Muskmelon and lime flavors start off tasting sweet, but are quickly reined in by brisk acidity, finishing chalky and tart. This is a fine Riesling, yet slightly disappointing in the context of previous vintages.
title: Martinborough Vineyard 2001 Riesling (Martinborough)

description: Tohu's latest Pinot Noir boasts somewhat simple cherry and charred-oak flavors but decent weight and texture, with some fine-grained tannins on the finish. Drink now.
title: Tohu 2006 Pinot Noir (Marlborough)

description: Tohu's latest Pinot Noir boasts somewhat simple cherry and charred-oak flavors but decent weight and texture, with some fine-grained tannins on the finish. Drink now.
title: Tohu 2006 Pinot Noir (Marlborough)

description: This medium-bodied Sauvignon's aromas show a pronounced grassy, passion-fruit character, while the flavors are based on melon, but also boast strongly herbal overtones, culminating in a slightly sour, passion-fruit finish.
title: Stonecrop 2007 Sauvignon Blanc (Martinborough)

description: A rare disappointment from Saint Clair—and it's still a good wine, just not up the standards set by the winery's other reserve wines. Ripe, peachy fruit is not so much framed by oak as covered by it, starting and finishing with layers of buttered toast and vanilla.
title: Saint Clair 2006 Omaka Reserve Chardonnay (Marlborough)

description: Nicely rendered Chard at a reasonable price, this easy-to-drink wine keeps the oak influence understated, bolstering its pear, melon and pineapple fruit with subtle shadings of spice and toast. Clean and fresh on the finish.
title: Nobilo 2006 Regional Collection Chardonnay (East Coast)

description: This is clearly labeled as "Certified Sustainable," although, to be fair, a lot of other New Zealand wines are also sustainably produced. Once past the labeling, 's a light- to medium-bodied wine, with slightly vegetal notes of nettles and garden peas that add nuance to refreshing citrus flavors.
designation: Three Brooms Single Vineyard Certified Sustainable
title: Barker's Marque 2014 Three Brooms Single Vineyard Certified Sustainable Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

description: This is on the pungent side, boasting aromas of boxwood and white grapefruit. Try it with a ceviche or herb-steamed mussels to lessen the impact, or embrace the potent, leaf-inflected flavors on their own. Either way, savor the silky texture and crisp, vibrant finish.
title: Forrest 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

description: This wine harmoniously blends hints of cut grass and struck flint with pink grapefruit. It's medium in body, not at all overdone, delivering the long citrus and berry finish with the precision of cut crystal.
title: Huia 2015 Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

description: Despite coiming in at only 12.5% abv, this is fairly weighty. Restrained aromas of crushed stone set the stage, then bold peach and melon flavors take over, finishing with a bit of celery leaf. Drink now.
title: Forrest 2015 The Doctors' Grüner Veltliner (Marlborough)

description: Relatively light bodied, this Sauvignon Blanc has pungent aromas of crushed tomato leaf and nettles. It's a green style from start to finish, capped off by lime-like acids.
title: Giesen 2010 The Brothers Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

description: A solid effort for the price, marrying hints of pencil-like oak with bright pineapple and lemon drop flavors. There's ample weight and texture without going over the top, and a moderately long finish. Drink up.
title: Fernz 2009 Chardonnay (Marlborough)

description: Ripe and round in style, this large-production (almost 100,000 cases) Sauvignon Blanc may lack a bit of length, but otherwise offers a lush mouthful of stone and tropical fruit accented by modestly grassy notes.
title: Saint Clair 2011 Vicar's Choice Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

description: Ripe and round in style, this large-production (almost 100,000 cases) Sauvignon Blanc may lack a bit of length, but otherwise offers a lush mouthful of stone and tropical fruit accented by modestly grassy notes.
title: Saint Clair 2011 Vicar's Choice Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

description: This pretty Pinot is less concentrated than those in Palliser's The Great... series, but the fruit speaks louder nonetheless. Bright cherry fruit retains Martinborough's savory, earthy edge while finishing crisp, with a hint of tea leaf. Drink now.
title: Palliser Estate 2008 Pinot Noir (Martinborough)

description: This pretty Pinot is less concentrated than those in Palliser's The Great... series, but the fruit speaks louder nonetheless. Bright cherry fruit retains Martinborough's savory, earthy edge while finishing crisp, with a hint of tea leaf. Drink now.
title: Palliser Estate 2008 Pinot Noir (Martinborough)

description: This seems to be hurrying along its aging curve, showing a burnished gold color. It's smoky and intense, with citrusy fruit that's more like grapefruit than anything else, plus plenty of weight and bright acidity. Drink up.
title: Man O' War 2009 Valhalla Chardonnay (Waiheke Island)

description: This seems to be hurrying along its aging curve, showing a burnished gold color. It's smoky and intense, with citrusy fruit that's more like grapefruit than anything else, plus plenty of weight and bright acidity. Drink up.
title: Man O' War 2009 Valhalla Chardonnay (Waiheke Island)

description: Light-bodied and crisp, this delivers tart cherries and a whack of mocha-tinged oak, which dominates the finish.
title: Coopers Creek 2013 Pinot Noir (Hawke's Bay)

description: For such a large-production wine, this is admirably complex, featuring delicate herbal shadings accenting hints of nectarine and citrus. The texture is a bit oily, but that's balanced by a long, mouthwatering finish.
title: Yealands 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

description: Despite being labeled at 13% alcohol, this comes across as reasonably light in weight. Pleasantly dry in flavor, it boasts hints of citrus and wet stone. A silky feel marks the long, crisp finish.
title: Two Paddocks 2014 Red Bank Vineyard Riesling (Central Otago)

description: Nectarine and fig notes mark the nose, while the palate is mellow and well-ripened, then delivers a refreshing citrusy kick on the long, grapefruit finish. Drink this medium-bodied wine over the next 6–9 months.
title: Tussock Jumper 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

description: This wine's flavors maybe take it a step too far into baked apple and pear territory, adding superripe melon to the mix as well. It's full-bodied, silky textured and broad in the mouth, with a touch of warmth on the finish.
title: Marisco Vineyards 2015 The King's Thorn Waihopai Pinot Gris (Marlborough)

description: A classic NZ Riesling that's all about fruit: apples, pears and limes on the nose, with more of the same in the mouth. Medium-weight, but balanced by plenty of racy acidity that turns tart and malic on the finish.
title: Omaka Springs 2001 Riesling (Marlborough)

description: A classic NZ Riesling that's all about fruit: apples, pears and limes on the nose, with more of the same in the mouth. Medium-weight, but balanced by plenty of racy acidity that turns tart and malic on the finish.
title: Omaka Springs 2001 Riesling (Marlborough)

description: Its soft, beguiling aromas of brown sugar, cinnamon, pie crust and cranberries pull you in, then bright cherry flavors take over on the palate. Mouthfeel is light, yet caressing, and the flavors fan out on the finish, picking up notes of spice and cola. A pretty wine from start to finish.
title: Foxes Island 1999 Pinot Noir (Marlborough)

description: Aromas of toast, apricot, mint, honey and field dust make for a complex bouquet. The honeyed palate yields a trace of green herbs along with lemon rind and white pepper. Obviously there's a lot going on here, and for some it may be too “out there.” For others it will be a spot-on Kiwi offering with lots of individuality and character.
title: Pegasus Bay 2000 Sauvignon Blanc (Waipara)

description: Hawkes Bay is typically slightly warmer than Marlborough and its Sauvignons less green; this one bucks the trend, showing green bell pepper, herbs and lime, layered with warm apricot fruit. Lacks only a little cut to elevate it into the 90s, but that same softness makes it very approachable and easy to enjoy.
title: Esk Valley 2001 Sauvignon Blanc (Hawke's Bay)

description: Hawkes Bay is typically slightly warmer than Marlborough and its Sauvignons less green; this one bucks the trend, showing green bell pepper, herbs and lime, layered with warm apricot fruit. Lacks only a little cut to elevate it into the 90s, but that same softness makes it very approachable and easy to enjoy.
title: Esk Valley 2001 Sauvignon Blanc (Hawke's Bay)

description: In time, this may surpass the regular bottling, but for now it trails by a nose, thanks to some mushroom, bracken and lima bean scents that dampen the cola and beet flavors. As always, it's big, rich and full-bodied. Try in 2005.
title: Felton Road 2000 Block 3 Pinot Noir (Central Otago)

description: Round and fruity, with aromas of ginger, pineapple and mango. This is one of the most popular SBs in the world, and it's easy to see why. It's loaded with sweet, inoffensive citrus fruit and it comes with a soft, plush mouthfeel that's sure to win people over.
title: Cloudy Bay 2001 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

description: Round and fruity, with aromas of ginger, pineapple and mango. This is one of the most popular SBs in the world, and it's easy to see why. It's loaded with sweet, inoffensive citrus fruit and it comes with a soft, plush mouthfeel that's sure to win people over.
title: Cloudy Bay 2001 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

description: Melon, citrus and green-bean aromas get a lift from some smoky oak. The thick, meaty palate is also a tad oaky, but it comes through with plenty of ripe melon, citrus and a hint of butterscotch—presumably from the oak. The finish is full and evolves in layers, always a good sign of a wine's overall quality.
title: Wairau River 2000 Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

description: Intentionally made in a low-alcohol style, this is both a little underripe and a little sweet. Pungent notes of boxwood, white grapefruit and celery leaf don't lack for character or intensity, but the wine finishes short and noticeably sweet.
title: Brancott 2015 Flight Song Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

description: Intentionally made in a low-alcohol style, this is both a little underripe and a little sweet. Pungent notes of boxwood, white grapefruit and celery leaf don't lack for character or intensity, but the wine finishes short and noticeably sweet.
title: Brancott 2015 Flight Song Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

description: It's a bit simple and a bit soft, but this value-priced wine accomplishes its mission of bringing authentic Marlborough SB flavor to the U.S. at an affordable price. Gooseberry and lime flavors are touched with hints of honey and mint, finishing with a bit of sweetness.
title: Monkey Bay 2007 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

description: It's a bit simple and a bit soft, but this value-priced wine accomplishes its mission of bringing authentic Marlborough SB flavor to the U.S. at an affordable price. Gooseberry and lime flavors are touched with hints of honey and mint, finishing with a bit of sweetness.
title: Monkey Bay 2007 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

description: A clean, fresh Chardonnay, with less weight and body than most Central Otago examples. Green apple and lime flavors seem a bit tart, just balanced out by hints of ripe melon.
title: Sleeping Dogs 2006 Blair Gunn Block Chardonnay (Central Otago)

description: A clean, fresh Chardonnay, with less weight and body than most Central Otago examples. Green apple and lime flavors seem a bit tart, just balanced out by hints of ripe melon.
title: Sleeping Dogs 2006 Blair Gunn Block Chardonnay (Central Otago)

description: Well priced for the quality, Villa Maria's entry-level Pinot Noir delivers moderately assertive notes of dried leaves, black cherries, cola and oaky spices. It's concentrated and gently mouth-filling, with a silky finish. Drink it now and over the next two years.
title: Villa Maria 2010 Private Bin Pinot Noir (Marlborough)

description: Well priced for the quality, Villa Maria's entry-level Pinot Noir delivers moderately assertive notes of dried leaves, black cherries, cola and oaky spices. It's concentrated and gently mouth-filling, with a silky finish. Drink it now and over the next two years.
title: Villa Maria 2010 Private Bin Pinot Noir (Marlborough)

description: The fruit for this provocatively named bottling is sourced from the lower Waihopai, or “Spy Valley” section of Marlborough. It's a medium-bodied, supple wine that places the emphasis on earthy notes of beetroot and clove, and then adds in cherry fruit and vanillin. Long, savory and spicy on the finish.
title: Saint Clair 2010 Pioneer Block 15 Strip Block Pinot Noir (Marlborough)

description: The fruit for this provocatively named bottling is sourced from the lower Waihopai, or “Spy Valley” section of Marlborough. It's a medium-bodied, supple wine that places the emphasis on earthy notes of beetroot and clove, and then adds in cherry fruit and vanillin. Long, savory and spicy on the finish.
title: Saint Clair 2010 Pioneer Block 15 Strip Block Pinot Noir (Marlborough)

description: New Zealand's best known winery does a consistently good job with the Burgundian varieties, not just Sauvignon Blanc. The chunky, medium-bodied 2010 Pinot Noir displays ample intensity, length and complexity. Its savory style shows dark cherry fruit, with hints of mocha and grilled meat. Drink now–2020.
title: Cloudy Bay 2010 Pinot Noir (Marlborough)

description: This is a crisp, clean and zesty wine, built on a simple but tasty base of white grapefruit. It's light to medium in body, with a refreshing finish.
title: Jackson Estate 2013 Stich Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

description: A round, soft and easy-drinking Sauvignon Blanc, this wine offers an attractive blend of citrus fruit and pungent herbal notes. Drink now.
title: Salvatore Principe 2013 Last Call Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

description: For the price, this is a solid Chardonnay, offering up just you might expect. Hints of toasty oak, a suggestion of custardy textural richness and intense citrus fruit come together in a medium-bodied wine that should prove versatile at the table through the end of 2016.
title: Marisco Vineyards 2011 The King's Bastard Wairau Chardonnay (Marlborough)

description: This unspecified rosé blend of Pinot Noir and Pinot Gris offers bold cherry and cantaloupe aromas, some confected, bubblegum-like flavors and a clean, short finish.
title: Marisco Vineyards 2016 The Ned Pinot Rosé (Marlborough)

description: Piny and minty, which combine to give the pineapple fruit a decidedly medicinal edge. It's lightly sweet, balanced by healthy acidity, so might work well with herb-scented desserts, like lavender sorbet.
title: Lake Chalice 2001 Falcon Vineyard - Late Harvest Riesling (Marlborough)

description: Smoke and custard notes accent scents of wet stone and citrus, while the palate delivers white peach, lime and vanilla flavors. This is plump and full in the mouth, yet still finishes with mouthwatering precision.
title: Kumeu River 2012 Coddington Chardonnay (Kumeu)

description: This is somewhat generic and oaky, with its modest cherry fruit overwhelmed by baking spices, yet supple and superficially attractive. Drink now.
title: Kate Radburnd 2014 Vine Velvet Pinot Noir (Martinborough)

description: Saint Clair's main 2008 Pinot Noir features tart, pie-cherry fruit with some slightly woody, stemmy notes running through it. It's medium-bodied, with a bit of bitter char to the finish. Drink now.
title: Saint Clair 2008 Pinot Noir (Marlborough)

description: Saint Clair's main 2008 Pinot Noir features tart, pie-cherry fruit with some slightly woody, stemmy notes running through it. It's medium-bodied, with a bit of bitter char to the finish. Drink now.
title: Saint Clair 2008 Pinot Noir (Marlborough)

description: This starts off nicely enough, with hints of cherries, rose petals and cedar, but the promise isn't quite fulfilled on the palate, which is lightweight and simple, with cedar- and coffee-tinged oak gradually taking over.
title: Maude 2008 Pinot Noir (Central Otago)

description: This starts off nicely enough, with hints of cherries, rose petals and cedar, but the promise isn't quite fulfilled on the palate, which is lightweight and simple, with cedar- and coffee-tinged oak gradually taking over.
title: Maude 2008 Pinot Noir (Central Otago)

description: Sparkling Sauvignon Blanc—what more need be said? Since the bubbles aren't derived from a second fermentation, the wine tastes like a Marlborough Sauvignon Blanc with bubbles. Pineapple and passion fruit notes finish clean but short.
title: Ara NV One Estate Brut Sauvignon (Marlborough)

description: Sparkling Sauvignon Blanc—what more need be said? Since the bubbles aren't derived from a second fermentation, the wine tastes like a Marlborough Sauvignon Blanc with bubbles. Pineapple and passion fruit notes finish clean but short.
title: Ara NV One Estate Brut Sauvignon (Marlborough)

description: This is leaner and more citrusy than the majority of plump New Zealand Pinot Gris, but still offers plenty of interest. The apple and pear flavors are clean and precise, outlined by citrus and with a hint of stoniness on the finish.
title: Huia 2007 Pinot Gris (Marlborough)

description: A mouthfilling, off-dry Pinot Gris, Kim Crawford's 2007 continues his success with this variety. Pear and citrus notes finish clean, a refreshing blend of sugar and acid. Drink now.
title: Kim Crawford 2007 Pinot Gris (Marlborough)

description: Intensely perfumed, this is herbal but ripe, too, with fig and melon fruit aromas. It's boldly flavored in the same vein, with the only quibble being that it finishes a little short. A solid effort.
title: Seifried 2007 Sauvignon Blanc (Nelson)

description: This shows the sunny opulence of the vintage, brimming with tropical- and stone-fruit notes. Guava and nectarine flavors meet ample weight on the palate, balanced by a slightly chalky finish.
title: Whitehaven 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

description: This wine is weightier than expected, with a broad, round, soft mouthfeel that delivers subtle notes of green fig and citrus. There's a hint of wet stone as well, which adds a bit of interest.
title: Lagoon Hill 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Martinborough)

description: Winemaker Kim Crawford has crafted a dark, full-bodied Pinot Noir that could use another year or two of bottle age. The nose is slightly meaty and bacony, while the palate delivers dark flavors of black cherries, plums, cola and baking spices before turning firm on the finish. Drink 2018–2025.
title: Loveblock 2013 Pinot Noir (Central Otago)

description: Attractive scents of baking spices and ripe cherries mark the nose and palate of this medium-bodied wine. It's silky from start to finish, offering enough complex floral and spice notes to make it worthy of repeated sips. Drink now–2020.
title: Prophet's Rock 2013 Rocky Point Pinot Noir (Central Otago)

description: Note: This is the same wine labeled Blue Rock in other markets. It's a supple, dark wine that has explosive fruit. Loads of black cherries cascade from the glass, tinged with hints of black tea and violets. Drink now–2025.
title: Murdoch James 2014 High Block Pinot Noir (Martinborough)

description: Note: This is the same wine labeled Blue Rock in other markets. It's a supple, dark wine that has explosive fruit. Loads of black cherries cascade from the glass, tinged with hints of black tea and violets. Drink now–2025.
title: Murdoch James 2014 High Block Pinot Noir (Martinborough)

description: Unlike Marisco's 2015 The Ned Late Harvest, this is a botrytis-affected wine, featuring a darker color and more complex flavors. The aromas suggest Earl Grey tea and honey; the flavors resemble caramel-drizzled orange segments. A slightly bitter citrus-pith note marks the finish, providing balance.
designation: A Sticky End Late Harvest Waihopai
title: Marisco Vineyards 2014 A Sticky End Late Harvest Waihopai Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

description: This medium-bodied Sauvignon Blanc is slightly leafy in style, but balances that with lush citrus fruit. The crushed tomato stalk and grapefruit come together in a dry, harmonious finish that's mainstream delicious. Drink now.
title: Marisco Vineyards 2016 The Ned Waihopai River Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

description: In contrast to Giesen's Waihopai bottling, this shows much more decay. Mushrooms, dead leaves and a subdued earthiness anchor the wine's other notes of black cherry and cola. It's supple and medium-bodied, yet lacks a bit a length. Drink now.
designation: Single Vineyard Selection Dog Point Road
title: Giesen 2012 Single Vineyard Selection Dog Point Road Pinot Noir (Marlborough)

description: The brand name is a reference to the winemaker, George Elworthy, being married to the considerably more renowned winemaker, Jules Taylor. George's wine is a bargain compared to most Pinots on the market, offering ample cherry fruit backed by vanilla and herb notes. It's supple and medium bodied, with a soft, inviting finish. Drink now.
title: The Better Half 2013 Pinot Noir (Marlborough)

description: In some ways, this wine is too polite. The aromas and flavors of spring flowers and ripe cherries are subtle, while the texture and weight are restrained. Even if it's not a showstopper, it'll work well at the table with a wide variety of dishes—always supporting, not overshadowing, the food. Drink now.
title: Lawson's Dry Hills 2012 Reserve Pinot Noir (Marlborough)

description: Amisfield has been on a hot streak, and the 2007 continues that roll. The aromas show wonderfully high-toned cherry fruit, with a slightly herbal element that adds welcome complexity. In the mouth, the wine is full-bodied and richly textured, with its black cherry fruit framed by a hint of vanilla. Long and lush on the finish, this looks to be at its best now and for the next several years.
title: Amisfield 2007 Pinot Noir (Central Otago)

description: Amisfield has been on a hot streak, and the 2007 continues that roll. The aromas show wonderfully high-toned cherry fruit, with a slightly herbal element that adds welcome complexity. In the mouth, the wine is full-bodied and richly textured, with its black cherry fruit framed by a hint of vanilla. Long and lush on the finish, this looks to be at its best now and for the next several years.
title: Amisfield 2007 Pinot Noir (Central Otago)

description: This Marlborough Sauvignon Blanc is very easy to drink, if slightly lacking distinctiveness. Melon and fig flavors finish on a slightly grassy note, while the texture is plump and soft.
title: Smythe & Renfield 2010 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

description: This Marlborough Sauvignon Blanc is very easy to drink, if slightly lacking distinctiveness. Melon and fig flavors finish on a slightly grassy note, while the texture is plump and soft.
title: Smythe & Renfield 2010 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

description: This wine shows a fine balance between sweetness (74 g/L) and acidity, reminiscent of a spätlese style. Striking scents of crushed stone, beeswax and lime burst from the glass, while the flavors combine peach and citrus notes. The finish shines, marrying sugar and acid into a long, tongue-tingling finale.
title: Felton Road 2015 Bannockburn Riesling (Central Otago)

description: Pretty standard in terms of flavor profile, but well-executed, marrying toasty, pain grille aromas with flavors of vanilla, ripe pears and melon. Medium- to full-bodied, it finishes with a flourish of oak and spice.
title: Te Kairanga 2006 Chardonnay (Martinborough)

description: Saint Clair has strayed from their Marlborough roots to source this Merlot from Hawke's Bay. The result boasts nicely ripe black cherry flavors, not overwhelmed by oak, finishing juicy and refreshing. Drink now.
title: Saint Clair 2006 Vicar's Choice Merlot (Hawke's Bay)

description: This is a soft, open-knit wine that's ready to drink. Faintly herbal notes of damp moss and fresh mushrooms accent dark cherry and mocha shadings that glide to a plush finish.
title: Mahi 2012 Pinot Noir (Marlborough)

description: This medium-bodied wine doesn't reveal a lot of richness on the palate, yet still offers fruit-driven notes of Bing cherries and fresh greens. It's clean and refreshing on the finish.
title: Goldwater 2012 Wairau Valley Pinot Noir (Marlborough)

description: This medium-bodied wine doesn't reveal a lot of richness on the palate, yet still offers fruit-driven notes of Bing cherries and fresh greens. It's clean and refreshing on the finish.
title: Goldwater 2012 Wairau Valley Pinot Noir (Marlborough)

description: This is a pleasant, medium-bodied Pinot Noir from one of the most famous Pinot blocks in Marlborough. The palate is filled with bright, tart cherry fruit leading to a decently long finish.
title: Giesen 2012 Clayvin Single Vineyard Selection Pinot Noir (Marlborough)

description: Representing a new level of quality for Waiheke Syrah, this wine boasts captivating aromas of peppered meat, violets and cassis. It's full bodied without being heavy, and the flavors seamlessly blend fruity with savory for a thrilling ride. Finishes long, with firm tannins and a hint of espresso. Drink now¬–2018.
title: Man O' War 2008 Dreadnought Syrah (Waiheke Island)

description: Representing a new level of quality for Waiheke Syrah, this wine boasts captivating aromas of peppered meat, violets and cassis. It's full bodied without being heavy, and the flavors seamlessly blend fruity with savory for a thrilling ride. Finishes long, with firm tannins and a hint of espresso. Drink now¬–2018.
title: Man O' War 2008 Dreadnought Syrah (Waiheke Island)

description: Starts well, with pineapple and gooseberry aromas, but it doesn't seem that intense or concentrated on the palate. This is a medium-bodied, slightly creamy-textured wine that's easy to drink.
title: Konrad 2010 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

description: Like most 2012 Marlborough Pinots, this is crisp, with pie cherry fruit leading the way. Hints of campfire and button mushrooms add welcome complexity, ending on a long, mouthwatering note of tart fruit.
title: Dog Point 2012 Pinot Noir (Marlborough)

description: Marked by crunchy, just-ripe cherry fruit and some slightly herbal shadings, this nonetheless offers solid value. Thyme and bay notes add nuance, as does the silkiness on the finish. Ready to drink.
title: Sacred Hill 2013 Pinot Noir (Marlborough)

description: A solid value, this wine contains organoleptic cues reminiscent of Dr. Pepper: cola, cherry and spice. It's medium bodied, with a slightly open-knit but soft texture. Drink now–2016.
title: Ribbonwood 2013 Pinot Noir (Marlborough)

description: This Merlot-based rosé is a bit on the sweet side. It's juicy and simple, with red plum fruit that finishes with enough acidity for balance.
title: Kate Radburnd 2015 Berry Burst Rosé (Hawke's Bay)

description: Green notes reminiscent of tomato leaves accent fig and melon flavors. It's only medium in body, but comes across as otherwise ripe in style, with a medium-length finish.
title: Astrolabe 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

description: Intriguingly floral and savory upfront, this delicate wine then adds a deep base of ripe cherries that expand effortlessly across the palate, giving an impression of fullness without weight, suppleness without being soft. Finishes long, with a great deal of complexity.
title: Valli 2008 Waitaki Vineyard Pinot Noir (Central Otago)

description: Dry River's 2007 Pinot Noir reveals a slight herbal tinge to its dark fruit aromas and flavors, but it's a nuance that adds complexity and should develop into hints of tea and spice with additional bottle age. As always, it's not overly big or richly textured, but it is concentrated and intense. Drink 2012–2020.
title: Dry River 2007 Pinot Noir (Martinborough)

description: A terrific Pinot Noir value, Stonecrop's 2008 exhibits smoky, cedary aromas, but balances the oak with a solid foundation of cherry fruit and savory, mushroomy complexity. It's full bodied yet elegant, with a meaty finish. Drink now–2013.
title: Stonecrop 2008 Pinot Noir (Martinborough)

description: A terrific Pinot Noir value, Stonecrop's 2008 exhibits smoky, cedary aromas, but balances the oak with a solid foundation of cherry fruit and savory, mushroomy complexity. It's full bodied yet elegant, with a meaty finish. Drink now–2013.
title: Stonecrop 2008 Pinot Noir (Martinborough)

description: Nelson is an underappreciated source for New Zealand wines, but this Pinot Noir shows ample cherry and beetroot notes, with hints of smoke and earth. Medium in weight on the midpalate, the finish is crisp and lithe. Drink now–2018.
title: Waimea 2013 Pinot Noir (Nelson)

description: Despite the effects of a cool year, this wine is still enjoyable. Its cherry fruit is tinged with notes of root vegetables and beet greens, and while there's ample weight, the tannins are just a touch drying on the finish.
title: Greywacke 2012 Pinot Noir (Marlborough)

description: Despite the effects of a cool year, this wine is still enjoyable. Its cherry fruit is tinged with notes of root vegetables and beet greens, and while there's ample weight, the tannins are just a touch drying on the finish.
title: Greywacke 2012 Pinot Noir (Marlborough)

description: The pungent aromas of grass, waxy lemon and canned corn on the nose are followed by more citrus and overripe melon on a palate. This is zippy and clean but finishes slightly bitter.
title: Smart Cookie 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

description: A slightly pungent sweatiness is an appealing facet of this wine, helping to accentuate its vibrant tropical flavors of passion fruit and pineapple. It's round in the mouth, then draws to a crisp, refreshing conclusion. Drink now.
title: Mount Fishtail 2013 Single Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

description: A slightly pungent sweatiness is an appealing facet of this wine, helping to accentuate its vibrant tropical flavors of passion fruit and pineapple. It's round in the mouth, then draws to a crisp, refreshing conclusion. Drink now.
title: Mount Fishtail 2013 Single Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

description: Saint Clair's main Sauvignon Blanc bottling came out really well in 2013, balancing green leafy notes with grapefruit elements. It's not as big or bold as some of the Pioneer Block wines, but instead boasts a sense of firmness and a fine line of chalk and acid from start to finish.
